org.jdesktop.jdic.misc
Class Volume

java.lang.Object
  org.jdesktop.jdic.misc.Volume
public class Volume
extends java.lang.Object

Volume allows the developer to get, set, and watch the system volume. Currently only Mac OS X is supported. To avoid polling you can watch the volume by adding a property change listener that looks for the 'volume' property.

Example: how to get and set the current volume.


        final Volume vol = Volume.newInstance();

        // get the volume
        float current_volume = vol.getVolume();

        // increase volume by 10%		
        if (vol.getVolume() < 1f) {
                vol.setVolume(vol.getVolume() + 0.1f);
        }

Example: how to add a property listener to watch for volume changes


import java.beans.*;

....

        final Volume vol = Volume.newInstance();

        PropertyChangeListener pcl  =
                new PropertyChangeListener() {
                        public void propertyChange(PropertyChangeEvent evt) {
                                Float old_vol = (Float)evt.getOldValue();
                                Float new_vol = (Float)evt.getNewValue();
                                System.out.println("new volume is: " + new_vol);
                        }
                };

        vol.addPropertyListener(pcl);

Author:
Joshua Marinacci joshua@marinacci.org

Constructor Detail

Volume

protected Volume()
Do not call. Implementation detail. Only for subclass use.

Method Detail

getVolume

public float getVolume()
Gets the current system volume as a float. The volume will range from 0.0 to 1.0. A value of -1 indicates that the volume was not available.

Returns:
The volume value

setVolume

public void setVolume(float vol)
Set the current system volume. The value must be in the range of 0.0 to 1.0.

Parameters:
vol - The new volume value

addPropertyListener

public void addPropertyListener(java.beans.PropertyChangeListener listener)
Add a PropertyChangeListener. Volume will return property change events for the 'volume' property.

Parameters:
listener - The feature to be added to the PropertyListener attribute

newInstance

public static Volume newInstance()
Get the Volume implementation for the currently running platform. If no implemenation is available a dummy Volume will be returned which does nothing.

Returns:
Description of the Return Value

fireChangeEvent

protected void fireChangeEvent(java.beans.PropertyChangeEvent pce)
Do not call. Implementation detail. Only for subclass use.

Parameters:
pce - Description of the Parameter
